metadata.title: CVE-2021-29338 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
Integer Overflow in OpenJPEG v2.4.0 allows remote attackers to crash theapplication, causing a Denial of Service (DoS). This occurs when theattacker uses the command line option "-ImgDir" on a directory thatcontains 1048576 files.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-29338` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u6ubuntu0.1~esm6
libopenjp2-tools - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u6ubuntu0.1~esm6
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u6ubuntu0.1~esm6
libopenjp3d7 - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u6ubuntu0.1~esm6
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u6ubuntu0.1~esm6
libopenjpip-server - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u6ubuntu0.1~esm6
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u6ubuntu0.1~esm6
libopenjpip7 - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u6ubuntu0.1~esm6
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: openjpeg2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.2-1.1+deb9u6ubuntu0.1~esm6').
insighttoolkit4 package in xenial is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it (note: '2022-01-05').
blender package in xenial is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it (note: '2022-01-05').
texmaker package in xenial is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it (note: '2022-01-05').
